item.title: Magician/Warlock (Blue Dragon/Unseen Offensive)
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Soulshade55r:

Night Ability(2): Whirlwind, select two players anyone trying to visit the first will be redirected to the second (4 Uses)

The problem I have with this ability is the difficulty of counterplaying a one way bus driver.

Simply put, this ability allows the Magician to protect a target from far too many things, and doesn’t have any restrictions like merc guard does.

Let’s propose a scenario for this class:

  • Prince outs d1
  • There is no Sellsword

This ability in and of itself saves prince from almost everything that could kill them, alongside being confirmable unlike a knight’s guard.

Reaper can’t kill, Poss can’t kill, Sorc can ‘potentially’ kill (albeit difficult considering physicians). The concept of a one-way bus driver is incredibly strong, and in practice the confirmability of it makes it even stronger.

I can’t quite propose something that would fix it, as the concept itself is unfun to play against if it can target players other than themselves.

Soulshade55r:

Night Ability(1): Incapacitate, Select two players they will be unable to visit each other or yourself tonight (Infinite)

This is a fine ability, but should be rephrased to occupying instead of preventing for obvious reasons.

In addition, I don’t think the additional clause of ‘or yourself’ is necessary as you could just make it possible to target yourself with the ability given the occupy immunity native to the class along with the prior point. What I’m saying is that the additional clause is significantly too strong.

Upon further thought I believe that the idea struggles fundamentally to work out without being too strong. The ‘yourself’ clause makes the class incredibly difficult to kill while also giving it mass clear potential in the case that they do die.

I’d propose a change to remove the ‘yourself’ clause, and then make that clause into a day ability that ‘empowers’ their night ability.

Soulshade55r:

Day Ability(1): Backfire, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target themselves, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)

It’s pointlessly confirmable.

Considering cooperation is significantly easier during the day than night (see gossip vs PoF), an ability like the prince’s jail or sheriff’s scout can instantly confirm the Magician to be what they say they are.

It can even be used with abilities like Inoculate/Exhume/etc.

The point that I’m getting across is that this type of ability is unbalanced in its ease of confirmability.

Soulshade55r:

Day Ability(2): Sway, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target you, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)

Same problem as Backfire.

item.title: Magician/Warlock (Blue Dragon/Unseen Offensive)
item.dc:creator: Soulshade55r
item.description:
Magician (Blue Dragon Offensive)

Passive(1): Trickster, Occupy and Redirection Immune, You keep this passive even if your class changes.
Passive(2): Magic Barrier, if someone visits you that is incapacitated it will protect you from there visit, but you’ll lose this passive after they attempt to visit, You’ll be notified when you lose this passive “Someone Incapacitated tried to visit you, but you occupied them, you’ve lost the Magic Barrier Passive”
Day Ability(1): Backfire, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target themselves, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)
Day Ability(2): Sway, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target you, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)
Night Ability(1): Incapacitate, Select two players they will be occupied if they visit each other. (Infinite)
Night Ability(2): Whirlwind, select two players anyone trying to visit the first will be redirected to the second (3 Uses)

Warlock (Unseen Offensive)

Passive(1): Trickster, Occupy and Redirection Immune.
Day Ability(1): Backfire, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target themselves, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)
Day Ability(2): Manipulate, if a player targets a player with a day ability they will target you or your selected target, you cannot target King and this doesn’t work against voting abilities. (3 Uses)
Night Ability(1): Seal, Occupy players on your select Unseen members or yourself any attempted visitors will show up as Unseen, You’ll learn who tried to visit that player. (2 uses)
Night Ability(2): Whirlwind, select two players anyone trying to visit the first will be redirected to the second (Infinite)

Invoker

Gains a two use of Manipulate that can also target the player themselves. Named Utilise

Sellsword

Gains a three use of Manipulate that can also target the player themselves. Named Utilise

Changes in addition to this class:
Reaper, Empower reap will bypass occupy Immunity as well.
Possessor, To be discussed.
